info.title: Canopy Servicing Core API
info.description:
**API Overview** 
 Canopy allows you to easily manage credit products from a servicing and compliance perspective - whether newly launched or migrated from existing systems. Using Canopy, you can track balances and transactions for each user of your product, both in real-time and historically. You can access and track information related to disputes, see how various policy and product changes would impact your users, and readily generate compliance reports and minimize your risk with all real-time information always on hand. 
 
 Simply configure your productâ€™s policies through our [Policy Management Dashboard](https://canopyservicing.com), and then you can immediately begin adding users and relying on Canopy for accurate servicing information. 
  
 **Getting Started** 
 *Get started in three easy steps.* 
 
 1) [Contact us](mailto:anurag@canopyservicing.com?subject=API%20Access%20Request) to request API Keys 
 
 2) Configure policies 
       a) For most uses, we recommend using the [Policy Management Dashboard](https://canopyservicing.com) 
       b) If you will be configuring many credit products programmatically or require niche configurations, you can also configure products in Canopy directly through our Policy Management API. 
 
 3) Once your product is configured and launched in Canopy, you have access to the full power of the Servicing API! You can take advantage of our sample workflows, or construct your own using this API documentation. 
 
 **Authentication** 
 To request an API key, [contact us](mailto:anurag@canopyservicing.com?subject=API%20Access%20Request).

post.description:
At its core, Canopy allows you to create credit products that meet the specific needs of your users. We offer robust options to configure these products within our system. 
 
 For most use cases, we recommend configuring products by using the [Policy Management Dashboard](https://canopyservicing.com); however, you can also configure and manage products programmatically. 
 
 Request body for creating a new product. 
 
 The following fields are minimum requirements for products to be published with the `live` status: 
 - `name` 
 - `default_rate` 
 - `default_credit_limit_cents` 
 `policies` (with an appropriate Base Policy Configuration)

get.summary: Get line items for a specific account.
get.description: Line Items for an Account consist of `charges` to the account and `payments` by the account holder. Results are paginated and sorted by line item effective date.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Account ID

parameters.name: effective_as_of_date
parameters.description: The `Date-Time` you would like the system to return the data as of. IE tell me what the line items were on `2020-10-20 00:00:00 EST`. If empty it defaults to current time.

parameters.name: line_item_type
parameters.description: The type of line items you would like to view. Options are `charges` and `payments`. If not provided, no filters will be applied.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-indexed starting point for paginated line item requests sorted by line item effective date.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of line items to be returned. Defaults to 100.

200.description: Array of Line Items and their corresponding balances at their effective dates and times.

type.description: The Line Item Type. Either `charge` or `payment`.

originating_amount_cents.description: The originating amount of money (in cents) relating to this line item.

balance_amount_cents.description: The current balance of the line item, which accounts for interest accrued per the `product's` interest policy and the `account's` interest rate attribute.

total_interest_accrued_cents.description: The sum (in cents) of all interest charges, if any, applied to this line item

total_paid_down_cents.description: The sum (in cents) of all payment splits, if any, applied to this line item

effective_at.description: The `Date-Time` that this account became/becomes active

created_at.description: The `Date-Time` which the account was created in the API

product_id.description: the Product ID of the account

description.description: A description of this particular line item if any. More common for adjustments.

reference_id.description: User ID in your system to associate with the payment for the account defined in Canopy.

dispute_id.description: The ID for a dispute if present for this line item.

external_ids.description: An array of static references to ID fields in a third party system.

line_item_count.description: Total number of line items for the account.

status.description:
The status to publish this product with. This can only be `live` if all fields necessary for product creation are populated. 
 If not included and all fields necessary for product creation are populated, the product will publish to the `live` state. 
 If not included and any necessary fields for product creation are not populated, the product will publish to the `draft` state.
